name: Sulfuryl chloride
desc: Sulfuryl chloride is an inorganic compound with the formula SO2Cl2. At room temperature, it is a colorless liquid with a pungent odor. Sulfuryl chloride is not found in nature, as can be inferred from its rapid hydrolysis.

images.alt: Structure and dimensions of sulfuryl chloride

Other names:
Sulfonyl chloride
Sulfuric chloride
Sulfur dichloride dioxide
Appearance: Colorless liquid with a pungent odor. Yellows upon standing.
Solubility: miscible with benzene, toluene, chloroform, CCl4, glacial acetic acid
Related compounds:
Thionyl chloride
Chlorosulfonic acid
Sulfuric acid
standard state:
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their standard state (at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
